snippet: The people of Swaziland say they do not mind having a king, but they want greater democracy and a bigger piece of the nation’s wealth.
abstract: Mbabane Journal; tensions are increasing between the populace of Swaziland, Africa's last absolute monarchy, and King Mswati III, who leads a lavish lifestyle while his subjects endure high taxes and increasing privations; citizens support the monarchy as a national symbol, but demand greater democracy and a larger share of the country's wealth.
lead_paragraph: The people of Swaziland say they do not mind having a king, but they want greater democracy and a bigger piece of the nation’s wealth.

headline.seo: Strikers Demand Democracy and Pay Raises in Swaziland
headline.main: Outside a King’s Plush Halls, Streets Rise in Anger
headline.print_headline: Outside a King’s Plush Halls, Streets Rise in Anger
